personalInfo.clubAffl: Tonto Verde GC (Scottsdale, Arizona); Firethorn GC (Lincoln, Nebraska)

tourBios.exmtStatus: Conditional - Web.com Tour Past Champion/5-10 Years (2011-2006)
tourBios.otherVics: (4) 2003 Waterloo Open, Utah Open. 2005 New Mexico Open, Nevada Open.
tourBios.carHigh:
2014: Played in 13 Web.com Tour events and made two cuts (T54 at the Stonebrae Classic and T70 at the Brasil Champions).

2013: Made the cut in three of 15 Web.com Tour starts. Best week was a T26 at the Brasil Classic presented by HSBC. Did not qualify for the Web.com Tour Finals' events. 

2012: Made the cut in 10 of 23 starts and had a pair of top-25 finishes. Was T12 at the Mylan Classic and T16 at the TPC Stonebrae Championship. 



2011: In just his second start of the year, shot a final-round, 8-under 64 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship to pull away and win his first Web.com Tour title. He opened the tournament by shooting a 10-under 62 and kept his momentum all week. He managed only one birdie through the first six holes Sunday but then made three on holes 7, 8 and 11 and then added four more to win by five strokes. It was only his second start of the season while playing on a Minor Medical Exemption. He has struggled with a back injury for most of the last two seasons. In his initial start of the campaign, he was T49 one week earlier, at the Cox Classic, earning him a spot in the Springfield, Mo., tournament field. His previous-best Tour finish was a T7 at the 2009 HSBC New Zealand PGA Championship. The win allowed him to move all the way to No. 23 on the money list...Did not have another top-25 finish following his victory and ended the season No. 51 on the money list. 

2010: Did not make a Web.com Tour start. 

2009: Finished No. 93 on the Web.com Tour money list after making 13 cuts in 23 starts but had only one top-10 finish. Had his best week of the year at the HSBC New Zealand PGA Championship, where he held a one-stroke lead after 54 holes before eventually settling for a T7. Followed that with a T13 at the Michael Hill New Zealand Open the next week...Was T4 at the 2008 Canadian Tour Championship.

2008: Was one for five in Web.com Tour tournaments entered, with his only cut made a T18 at the Livermore Valley Wine Country Championship. 



2007: Made three of seven cuts, with a T9 at the same Livermore tournament. 

2004: Lone start on the PGA TOUR came at the AT&T Pebble Beach National Pro-Am, where he finished T41. 



2005: Added a pair of state open titles to his resume, winning the New Mexico Open and the Nevada Open.

2003: Captured the Waterloo Open and the Utah Open.

2001: Won the Tight Lies Tour's Baton Rouge Open.
tourBios.otherCarHigh: Four-year letter winner at the University of Nebraska, where he was a college teammate of Web.com Tour member Scott Gutschewski and former Tour player Jamie Rogers. Won the Kansas Invitational as a sophomore. Two-time All-Big 12 first-team choice, three-time all-district choice and was named academic All-America in 1998 and winner of the 1999 Ben Hogan Award.
tourBios.personal: Former Web.com Tour member Mike Schuchart are among those who have taught him over the years...Is a big fan of the band Iron and Wine...Lists Prairie Dunes in Kansas, The Homestead in Virginia and Sand Hills in Nebraska as three of his favorite courses.

tourBios.intlVics: (4) 2003 Waterloo Open, Utah Open. 2005 New Mexico Open, Nevada Open.

dyn.dynResults: His best finish on the Web.com Tour was 1st in 2011 at the Price Cutter Charity Championship Presented by Dr Pepper.
